secureKeys.title: Secure secret key
secureKeys.text:
The public key can be shared safely – it is like an account number.

The secret key is the access to your account. Treat it like a password:
• NEVER store it in cloud services, emails, or unsecured notes
• Write it down on paper or use a hardware wallet
• Create multiple backups and store them in secure, separate locations
• If the secret key is lost, access to the account is irretrievably lost

multisigSection.title: Multisig (multi-signature)
multisigSection.text:
With multisig, you can define multiple signers for your account. Transactions then require signatures from multiple keys (e.g., 2 out of 3).

Advantages:
• Increased security (a compromised key is not sufficient)
• Shared accounts (e.g., companies, partnerships)
• Emergency recovery (multiple backups with different people)

WARNING: Test multisig first on the testnet before deploying it on the mainnet! Incorrect configuration can result in losing access to the account.

signersCountLimit: Note: Network limit (Stellar): max. 20 additional signers.

thresholdHelp: Threshold: The number of required signatures (master + signatories) for a transaction to be valid.
thresholdLevelsHint: Typically, the following applies: low = simple changes (e.g., memo, price), medium = payments/trade, high = security-critical changes (e.g., signers/thresholds).
thresholdTooHigh: Note: A threshold must not exceed the sum of the weights. Please adjust the values accordingly.

tooltips.masterWeight: Weight of the Account Owner (Master) (0-255): The main key of the account has a voting right. The higher its weight, the more votes its signature counts for. These votes are counted together with the votes of other signers to check if the required majority has been reached.
tooltips.signerWeight: Signers' Weight (0–255): Additional signers also have voting rights. The weight determines how many votes their signature contributes. When a transaction is sent, all cast votes are summed up. If the specified minimum number of votes (threshold) is reached, the transaction is considered authorized.
tooltips.signerWeightHint: Note: Master and signer weights constitute the total; thresholds (low/medium/high) must not exceed this total.
